Package imagingbook.pub.edgepreservingfilters

Class BilateralFilterVector

  • java.lang.Object
    • imagingbook.lib.filter.GenericFilter
      • imagingbook.lib.filter.GenericFilterVector
        • imagingbook.pub.edgepreservingfilters.BilateralFilterVector
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ProgressReporter
    public class BilateralFilterVector
extends GenericFilterVector
    Vector version, for RGB images only (accepts ColorProcessor only). This class implements a bilateral filter as proposed in C. Tomasi and R. Manduchi, "Bilateral Filtering for Gray and Color Images", Proceedings of the 1998 IEEE International Conference on Computer Vision, Bombay, India. The filter uses Gaussian domain and range kernels and can be applied to all image types.
    Version:
    2021/01/01

    • Method Detail

      • doPixel

        protected float[] doPixel​(PixelPack pack,
                          int u,
                          int v)
        Description copied from class: GenericFilterVector
        This method defines the steps to be performed for a single image pixel and must be implemented by any concrete sub-class. The source data are passed as a PixelPack container, which holds the pixel values of all image components. The method PixelPack.getVec(int, int) should be used to read individual pixel vectors. These data should not be modified but the (float[]) result of the single-pixel calculation must be returned. Implementations are free to return the same float-array at each invocation, i.e., there is no need to allocate a new array every time.
        Specified by:
        doPixel in class GenericFilterVector
        Parameters:
        pack - the vector-valued image data
        u - the current x-position
        v - the current y-position
        Returns:
        the result of the filter calculation for this pixel
